title: What are some classic rock songs to introduce to someone that's never heard it and have the person instantly love the genre? - Quora

response.answer_text: Okay I’m going to stick primarily to the 60’s and 70’s which is considered the heyday of Classic Rock, and this is in no particular order… 1.) The Entire Who’s Next album by the WHO 2.) Dream On - Aerosmith 3.) Gimmie Shelter - Rolling Stones 4.) Brown Sugar - The Rolling Stones 5.) Honkytonk Woman - The Rolling Stones 6.) Purple Haze - Jimi Hendrix 7.) Fortunate Son - CCR 8.) Born to Run - Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band 9 .) Rosalita - Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band 10.) Already Gone - The Eagles 11.) Hotel California - The Eagles 12.) Life in the Fast Lane - The Eagles 13.) Hollywood Nights - Bob Seger 14.) R&R All Night (live version) KISS 15.) Layla - Derek and The Dominos (Clapton) 16.) Suite Judy Blue Eyes - CSN&Y 17.) Rock and Roll Hoochie Koo - Rick Derringer or Johnny Winter version 18.) Barracuda - Heart 19.) I Want You to Want Me - Cheap Trick 20.) You Shook Me All Night Long - AC/DC 21.) The Boys Are Back in Town - Thin Lizzy 22.) Paperback Writer - The Beatles 23.) Hey Jude - The Beatles 23.) Alright Now - Free 24.) Rocky Mountain Way - Joe Walsh 25.) Walk Away - James Gang 26.) Funk #49 - James Gang 27.) Radar Love - Golden Earing 28.) Fool For the City (live version)- Foghat 29. ) Slow Ride (live version)- Foghat 30.) I just Want To Make Love To You (live version) - Foghat 31.) Maggie May - Rod Stewart 32.) Bobby McGee - Janice Joplin 33. ) Hair of the Dog - Nazareth 34.) Mississippi Queen - Mountain 35.) Carry On Wayward Son - Kansas 36.) Suffragette City - David Bowie 37.) Rebel Rebel _ David Bowie 38.) Rock n Roll - Led Zepplin 39.) Stairway to Heaven - Led Zepplin 40.) Tie Your Mother Down - Queen 41.) We Will Rock You (live version, full band) - Queen 42.) Keep Yourself Alive - Queen 43.) Mama Kin - Aerosmith 44.) Black Magic Woman - Santana 45.) Midnight Rambler (live version) - Rolling Stones 46.) Walk This Way - Aerosmith 47.) Please Please - Stories 48.) I Wanna Be Sedated - The Ramones 49.) Cinnamon Girl - Neil Young 50.) Locomotive Breath - Jethro Tull And that’s just for starters…

I'm going to have to choose from each genre: Hard Rock + Blues Rock + Glam Rock: Boston - More Than A FeelingSmoke on the Water - Deep PurpleSweet Child Of Mine - Guns n RosesThunderstruck - ACDCHighway to Hell - ACDCWhole Lotta Love - Led ZeppelinWelcome to the Jungle - Guns n RosesCrazy - AerosmithPoison - Alice CoooperBohemian Rhapsody - QueenLa Grange - ZZ TopLayla - Eric ClaptonSweet Home Alabama + Free Bird - Lynyrd SkynyrdLiving on a Prayer- Bon JoviImmigrant Song - Led ZeppelinFolk Rock: Sound of Silence - Simon and GarfunkelHouse of the Rising Sun - The AnimalsScarborough Fair - Simon and GarfunkelHotel California - EaglesBlack Magic Woman - SantanaGrunge: Smells Like Teen Spirit - NirvanaEven Flow - Pearl JamMan in the Box - Alice in ChainsCome As You Are - NirvanaInterstate Love Song - Stone Temple PilotsJeremy - Pearl JamCats in the Cradle - Ugly Kid Joe cover (originally by Harry Chapin)Progressive Rock: (and Space Rock) Comfortably Numb - Pink FloydEchoes - Pink FloydDogs - Pink FloydCygnus X-1 - RushStarless - King CrimsonComing Back to Life - Pink FloydPoseidon’s Creation + Child Migration + Through a Sombre Galaxy- Eloy (Underrated Unknown Band)Metal: Trooper - Iron MaidenSymphony of Destruction - MegadethDon't Talk To Strangers - Ronnie James DioWasted Years - Iron Maiden (my personal favourite)Aces High - Iron MaidenEnter Sandman (Good Ol Classic) - Metallica and the cover by MotörheadNothing Else Matters - MetallicaRun to the Hills - Iron MaidenIron Man - Black SabbathJimi Hendrix: All Along the Watchtower (credits to Bob Dylan)Voodoo ChildHey JoeAnyone who has suggestions, please leave a comment below
